Documents/Programming/ClassesObjC/SSYSynchronousHTTP.h

00001 // This class is a wrapper for NSURLConnection.
00002 // It is called SSYSynchronousHTTP because it blocks until a response, timeout, or user cancel occurs
00003 // The connection is run in a secondary thread, to allow the main thread to cancel, etc.
00004 // By setting #define in the .m file, CURL may be used instead of NSURLConnection
00005 
00006 #import <Cocoa/Cocoa.h>
00007 
00008 #define CURL 0   // Use CURLHandle.  You must include CURLHandle in project for this to work. 
00009 #define APPLE 1  // Use Apple's URL Loading System; i.e. NSURLConnection
00010 #define FAKE 2   // Do not make any connection, just delay a little.  This is for debuggingNoMatchErr.  You must include FakeConnection in project for this to work.
00011 
00012 /******* BEGIN COMPILE PARAMETERS *********/
00013 
00014 #define CONNECTION APPLE
00015 
00016 /********* EMD COMPILE PARAMETERS *********/
00017 
00018 enum {
00019         SSSynchronousHTTPResponseFinished = 0,
00020     SSSynchronousHTTPResponseRedirect = 10, // Not used at this time because we follow redirects
00021     SSSynchronousHTTPResponseNoAccountInfoForAuthenticationChallenge = 20,
00022     SSSynchronousHTTPResponseAccountInfoFailsAuthenticationChallenge = 25,
00023         SSSynchronousHTTPLoginFailed = 27,
00024         SSSynchronousHTTPResponseNotHTTP = 30,
00025     SSSynchronousHTTPTimeout = 40,
00026         SSSynchronousHTTPCancelled = 50,
00027         SSSynchronousHTTPConnectionFailed = 60,
00028         SSSynchronousHTTPNonStarter = 70,
00029         SSSynchronousHTTPWaiting = 80
00030 } ;
00031 
00032 
00033 enum SSHTTPAlertOption {
00034         SSHTTPAlertOptionNone,
00035         SSHTTPAlertOptionUseAsIs,
00036         SSHTTPAlertOptionPushAndShowContacting,
00037         SSHTTPAlertOptionPushAndShowContactingWithCancel
00038 } ;
00039 
00040 #if CONNECTION == CURL
00041 @class CURLHandle ;
00042 #endif
00043 
00044 @interface SSYSynchronousHTTP : NSObject
00045 {
00046         // "SEL" is a type which specifies a method
00047         // "@selector(...)" is a keyword which converts a method name to a SEL value
00048         // SEL        aSelector; 
00049         // aSelector = @selector(setObject:forKey:); 
00050         
00051         // Object instance variables
00052 #if CONNECTION == CURL
00053         CURLHandle* _connection;
00054 #elif CONNECTION == APPLE
00055         NSURLConnection* _connection ;
00056 #endif
00057         NSString* _username ;
00058         NSString* _password ;
00059         NSTimer* _timeOutTimer ;
00060         NSHTTPURLResponse* _response ;
00061         NSMutableData* _responseData ;
00062         NSError* _error ;
00063         NSAutoreleasePool* _workerPool ;
00064         NSLock* _lock ;
00065         
00066         // Non-object instance variables
00067         float _timeout ;        
00068         BOOL _cancelled ;
00069         int _responseState ;
00070 }
00071 
00072 // Blocks until response, -cancel, or timeout,
00073 + (int)SSSynchronousHTTPURL:(NSString*)url
00074                                  httpMethod:(NSString*)httpMethod
00075                                  bodyString:(NSString*)bodyString 
00076                                    username:(NSString*)username
00077                                    password:(NSString*)password
00078                                         timeout:(float)timeout 
00079                                   userAgent:(NSString*)userAgent // defaults to CFNetwork if nil
00080                                 alertOption:(enum SSHTTPAlertOption)alertOption 
00081                                 hdlResponse:(NSHTTPURLResponse**)hdlResponse 
00082                         hdlResponseData:(NSData**)hdlResponseData 
00083                                    hdlError:(NSError**)hdlError ;
00084         // returns response state, as enumerated above
00085         // For more detailed error info, pass a hdlError
00086 
00087 @end
